main event: A pilot reported sighting a bright golden white object in the sky near Walhalla, Carolina, on September 22, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 5 minutes and was traveling at a medium velocity of 100 miles at an altitude of 20 miles., The object was sighted bearing NE and had a bright orange glow., The report suggests the possibility of the object being near Walhalla Island close to Strom Thurmond Reservoir., The communication indicated that the sighting occurred at a specific date-time group., The report mentions a detailed observation from the pilot regarding the object's course and color.
